title: Understanding Cognitive Symptoms
text: Cognitive symptoms in schizophrenia affect the mental processes involved in gaining knowledge and comprehension.

title: Examples of Cognitive Symptoms
text: These symptoms can include problems with memory, attention, and the ability to plan and organize.

hintAnswer: deficits in ability to think or reason
title: Identifying the Correct Answer
text: Which of the following best describes cognitive symptoms of schizophrenia?
choices: deficits in ability to think or reason
when a client is unaware that they are ill because of the illness itself

a gradual onset of nonspecific behaviors, such as sleep disturbances, suspiciousness, decreased attention to activities of daily living, disconnection with peers and family members, depressed mood, irritability, and problems focusing or understanding
